children.subject: As a fellow student who just got their 61C final exam grade back, I fully understand.  I sincerely hope you find your way into the major.  That being said, lets never talk, mention, or even think about 61C again.

history.content:
My roommate was in a similar position as you, though it was cs70 that pulled his gpa below a 3.0 and it was because he slacked off, not extenuating circumstances. His gpa was in the high 2.9x range and he successfully got in. 

I got a C in Math 1B and couldn't make up for it. My CS GPA was around 2.8 when I applied last semester, and I got in. To be fair, I had taken AP Calc BC and gotten a 5 and my GPA without Math 1B was over a 3.0

My roommate was in a similar position as you, though it was cs70 that pulled his gpa below a 3.0 and it was because he slacked off, not extenuating circumstances. His gpa was in the high 2.9x range and he successfully got in.

Hello,

Please feel free to make an advising appointment with me (in-person or via phone) to discuss further.

Best,

Charlene Hughes (CS Advisor); 510.642.2357, cdhughes@berkeley.edu

Unfortunately, I'm not going to be able to have above a 3.0, but rough estimate of my final GPA is in the 2.75-2.9 range. I don't have any "extenuating" consequences as in had to work full-time, illnesses, etc., but 61C killed my GPA and I slipped my first semester at Cal and ended up with a B- in math 1A, which is non-reflective of my math skills since I performed a lot better in 1B and 54. I'm really stressed about this--I haven't taken any classes for an alternative major, which in hindsight was a terrible idea, but I didn't think 61C would turn out this way.

Does anyone have any personal experiences with appealing?

(I have emailed the cs advisors a few days ago, but no replies since)
history.subject: Has anyone successfully petitioned into L&S CS despite having a GPA below the min requirement?
